name: Showstopper Quilt Block - PDF Pattern
description:
This block is a full-on showstopper! Stunning with loads of visual interest and secondary patterns, the Showstopper block contains complete cutting instructions for two block sizes: 10" and 12" finished.

The pattern is nine pages of full-color diagrams and thorough instructions every step of the way. This this block pattern is written in such a way that even someone with little paper piecing experience can do! If you make something using this pattern, please do share it with me! You can share it with me on Flickr in my Flickr group or on Instagram by tagging me (@dontcallmebetsy) or using the hashtag #dontcallmebetsy.

name: Lucky Stars Block of the Month Club - 2013 and 2014
description: Want to get in on the Lucky Stars fun? It's not too late! You can still join this year's Lucky Stars club, as well as next year's today. You'll receive the past blocks via email within 48 hours of your sign-up, and will continue to receive a block each month on the 1st of the month through the end of 2014.

name: Lucky Stars Block of the Month Club - 2014!
description:
Back by popular demand, the Lucky Stars Block of the Month Club will continue on in 2014 with twelve new star patterns. The PDF patterns will include detailed piecing instructions, with photographs and diagrams, as well as the block template(s). You will receive two sets of block templates each month, one for a 12" finished block and one for a 6" finished block, giving you lots of flexibility for using these blocks not only in your BOM quilt but in other patchwork projects as well.

These blocks are great for growing your 2013 Lucky Stars quilt or starting a whole new one! Each pattern is sent via email in PDF format to club members on the 1st of each month, to download and make right away or to save for a rainy day or sewing retreat. 

For only $15, you'll receive a total of 24 paper pieced star PDF templates, as well as support from yours truly. I hope you'll join in for some paper piecing fun!

name: Confetti Stars PDF Quilt Pattern
description:
This fantastic foundation paper pieced quilt is much easier than it looks! Confetti Stars is a great pattern for new and experienced paper piecers. Using two different blocks, you can create one of two completely different quilt looks - modern or traditional! 

This 12-page pattern includes detailed step-by-step directions to make four different quilt sizes using this two-block pattern, with full color block assembly diagrams. Because there are two different layout options with each quilt size, it's like getting 8 patterns in one!

name: Color My World PDF Quilt Pattern
description:
Featured in the January/Feburary 2013 edition of Quiltmaker magazine, this cheery quilt is much easier than it looks! Using the techniques in this pattern, your quilt blocks will come together easily and without hassle. 

This 9-page pattern includes detailed step-by-step directions to make five different quilt sizes using this one-block pattern, with full color block assembly diagrams. The pattern also includes a coloring sheet to give you the opportunity to plot out your color pairings for a truly unique quilt.

name: Sew Positive PDF Quilt Pattern
description:
The Sew Positive quilt was originally published in Quilts from Quiltmaker's 100 Blocks back in Spring 2013. This quilt was inspired by alternating some simple patchwork pluses, creating a vibrant, fun patchwork quilt that's easy to put together in a weekend. The blocks in this quilt will finish at 12" when sewn into the quilt. 

This 7-page pattern includes detailed step-by-step directions to make five different quilt sizes using this two-block pattern, with full color block assembly diagrams.

name: Becoming a Confident Quilter: Lessons and Techniques Plus 14 Quilt Patterns
description:
NOW IN STOCK!!! Order a signed copy of my first book! If you would like me to personalize the inscription, please add a note during the checkout process.

Becoming a Confident Quilter is chock full of fourteen quilt patterns, sure to appeal to both traditional and modern quilters. Each quilt is accompanied by step-by-step illustrations to help you understand how to piece each quilt. There's also a finishing section, showing you free-motion quilting and straight-line quilting options, as well my favorite way to bind quilts.

ISBN-13: 978-1604682311 
Publisher: Martingale & Company 
Publication date: 9/2013 
Pages: 96

Books will be shipped via USPS priority flat rate shipping. 
US = $5.75 
Canada = $34.95 
Australia = $44.95 
*note: if your country isn't listed, just ask and I'll figure out the shipping for you*

A LIMITED NUMBER OF BOOKS ARE IN STOCK NOW. You will be notified if I run out of books in stock.

name: Wheel of Fortune PDF quilt pattern
description:
The Wheel of Fortune paper pieced quilt pattern is a great way to show off some of your favorite scraps, or to pull together some of your favorite collections. The pattern includes templates in two sizes with this pattern: a 6" finished block set of templates and a 12" finished block set of templates. You can really get creative with negative space and block sizes to create your own Wheel of Fortune masterpiece!

15 page PDF pattern includes: 
* Yardage requirements 
* Cutting instructions
* Detailed piecing instructions with photographs throughout
* Five quilt sizes: mini (18" x 18"), baby (36" x 48"), lap (60" x 72"), queen (84" x 96"), and king (96" x 108")

This pattern will be emailed to you within 24 hours of purchase. 

Please do not distribute this pattern. You may not resell this pattern itself, though you are welcome to sell items made from this pattern.

This PDF quilt pattern is a great way to use up scraps of your precious favorite fabrics and pair them with other supporting prints or solids to allow your star centers to shine. This pattern is also precut friendly, as you can use charm packs for your star centers.

If you have any questions about this pattern, please don't hesitate to email me! Please note this is a PDF pattern, and you will need Adobe Acrobat or Adobe Reader to read the file.

name: Lucky Stars Block of the Month Club
description:
Club members will get a PDF pattern for the block of the month on the 1st of every month, beginning on January 1st. The PDF patterns will include detailed piecing instructions, with photographs and diagrams, as well as the block template(s). You will receive two sets of block templates each month, one for a 12" finished block and one for a 6" finished block, giving you lots of flexibility for using these blocks not only in your BOM quilt but in other patchwork projects as well.

You will also receive a practice block pattern, with basic paper piecing instructions to help you get started with paper piecing, if this is your first attempt. Club members will receive their practice block on December 26th. If you are purchasing this subscription after December 26th, you will receive your practice block pattern within 24 hours of your subscription purchase.

I will be there throughout the year to help you master this fantastic, fun quilting skill. And that's not all! I will be hosting Google Hangout chats throughout the year for members to chat and have a chance to share their successes and any troubles that they're running into with me and other club members. 

For only $15, you'll receive a total of 24 paper pieced star PDF templates, as well as support from yours truly.

name: Sea of Stars PDF quilt pattern
description:
This PDF quilt pattern is a great way to use up scraps of your precious favorite fabrics and pair them with other supporting prints or solids to allow your star centers to shine. This pattern is also precut friendly, as you can use charm packs for your star centers. 

7 page PDF pattern includes:
- Diagrams and detailed instructions 
- Five different finished quilt sizes for you to choose from: baby, lap/throw, twin, queen and king
- Yardage requirements and cutting instructions
- Quilt top assembly instructions

If you have any questions about this pattern, please don't hesitate to email me! Please note this is a PDF pattern, and you will need Adobe Acrobat or Adobe Reader to read the file.

name: Photo Corners PDF quilt pattern
description:
Have you ever fallen in love with a print so much that you couldn’t bring yourself to cut it up for a quilt?  Then this is the perfect pattern for you!  This pattern is just right for large-scale prints as well as fun novelty prints.  The blocks for this quilt are inspired by the traditional square snowball block and create a fun way to show off some of your favorite prints, much like the photo corners that are highly popular with scrapbookers.

The Photo Corners PDF quilt pattern includes all of the information you'll need to make this quilt, including color photos and complete piecing diagrams to follow, as well as requirements for batting and binding. Two finished sizes are available for you to choose from, baby size 47” x 51 ½” and lap size 62” x 71”.

This pattern is completely fat quarter or fat eighth friendly!

<u><a href="http://www.dontcallmebetsy.com/2012/01/introducingthe-photo-corners-quilt.html">See more of this quilt at dontcallmebetsy.com</u>

Please do not distribute this pattern. You may not resell this pattern itself, though you are welcome to sell items made from this pattern.

name: Xs and Os PDF quilt pattern
description:
What a wonderful way to show your quilty love - using the universal Xs and Os!  Using Xs and Os to represent hugs and kisses dates back to the early 1900s and has been used throughout the years in letters, and now in modern times in emails and text messages.  You can use this quilt to represent your hugs and kisses, using some simple quilting techniques, including half-square triangles and stitch-and-flip squares.   

The Xs and Os quilt PDF pattern includes all of the information you'll need to make this quilt, including color photos and complete piecing diagrams to follow, as well as requirements for batting and binding.  Two finished sizes are offered in this pattern: a 48" square baby quilt and a 72" x 96" twin size. This pattern is fully fat quarter friendly!

Please do not distribute this pattern. You may not resell this pattern itself, though you are welcome to sell items made from this pattern.

name: Fabricland quilt PDF quilt pattern
description:
The Fabricland quilt PDF pattern includes all of the information you'll need to make this quilt, including color photos and complete piecing diagrams to follow, as well as requirements for batting and binding.  The finished size of this quilt is 70" x 80".

Please do not distribute this pattern.  You may not resell this pattern itself, though you are welcome to sell items made from this pattern.
